properties.name: bevelBottomDepth
properties.description: Specifies the depth of the bottom bevel.

properties.name: bevelBottomInset
properties.description: Specifies the inset size for the bottom bevel.

properties.name: bevelBottomType
properties.description: Specifies a BevelType value that represents the bevel type for the bottom bevel.

properties.name: bevelTopDepth
properties.description: Specifies the depth of the top bevel.

properties.name: bevelTopInset
properties.description: Specifies the inset size for the top bevel.

properties.name: bevelTopType
properties.description: Specifies a BevelType value that represents the bevel type for the top bevel.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: contourColor
properties.description: Returns a ColorFormat object that represents color of the contour of a shape.

properties.name: contourWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the contour of a shape.

properties.name: depth
properties.description: Specifies the depth of the shape's extrusion.

properties.name: extrusionColor
properties.description: Returns a ColorFormat object that represents the color of the shape's extrusion.

properties.name: extrusionColorType
properties.description: Specifies whether the extrusion color is based on the extruded shape's fill (the front face of the extrusion) and automatically changes when the shape's fill changes, or whether the extrusion color is independent of the shape's fill.

properties.name: fieldOfView
properties.description: Specifies the amount of perspective for a shape.

properties.name: isPerspective
properties.description: Specifies true if the extrusion appears in perspective — that is, if the walls of the extrusion narrow toward a vanishing point, false if the extrusion is a parallel, or orthographic, projection — that is, if the walls don't narrow toward a vanishing point.

properties.name: isVisible
properties.description: Specifies if the specified object, or the formatting applied to it, is visible.

properties.name: lightAngle
properties.description: Specifies the angle of the lighting.

properties.name: presetCamera
properties.description: Returns a PresetCamera value that represents the camera presets.

properties.name: presetExtrusionDirection
properties.description: Returns the direction taken by the extrusion's sweep path leading away from the extruded shape (the front face of the extrusion).

properties.name: presetLighting
properties.description: Specifies a LightRigType value that represents the lighting preset.

properties.name: presetLightingDirection
properties.description: Specifies the position of the light source relative to the extrusion.

properties.name: presetLightingSoftness
properties.description: Specifies the intensity of the extrusion lighting.

properties.name: presetMaterial
properties.description: Specifies the extrusion surface material.

properties.name: presetThreeDimensionalFormat
properties.description: Returns the preset extrusion format.

properties.name: projectText
properties.description: Specifies whether text on a shape rotates with shape. true rotates the text.

properties.name: rotationX
properties.description: Specifies the rotation of the extruded shape around the x-axis in degrees.

properties.name: rotationY
properties.description: Specifies the rotation of the extruded shape around the y-axis in degrees.

properties.name: rotationZ
properties.description: Specifies the z-axis rotation of the camera.

properties.name: z
properties.description: Specifies the position on the z-axis for the shape.

methods.name: incrementRotationHorizontal
methods.description: Horizontally rotates a shape on the x-axis. The number of degrees to rotate.

methods.name: incrementRotationVertical
methods.description: Vertically rotates a shape on the y-axis. The number of degrees to rotate.

methods.name: incrementRotationX
methods.description: Changes the rotation around the x-axis. The number of degrees to rotate.

methods.name: incrementRotationY
methods.description: Changes the rotation around the y-axis. The number of degrees to rotate.

methods.name: incrementRotationZ
methods.description: Rotates a shape on the z-axis. The number of degrees to rotate.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: resetRotation
methods.description: Resets the extrusion rotation around the x-axis, y-axis, and z-axis to 0.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: setExtrusionDirection
methods.description: Sets the direction of the extrusion's sweep path.

methods.name: setPresetCamera
methods.description: Sets the camera preset for the shape. The preset camera type.

methods.name: setThreeDimensionalFormat
methods.description: Sets the preset extrusion format. The preset format.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.ThreeDimensionalFormat object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ThreeDimensionalFormatData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
